remarks: Terminal objects are essentially unique (strong form), i.e. there is a _unique_ isomorphism between two terminal objects, see statement in [Lang] p. 58 ("... if P, P' are two universal objects [[...] then there exists a unique isomorphism between them.".  (Proposed by BJ, 14-Apr-2020.)  (Contributed by AV, 18-Apr-2020.)

termoeu1.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( TermO ` C ) ) $.
termoeu1 $p |- ( ph -> E! f f e. ( A ( Iso ` C ) B ) ) $.
